sub_title: Assistant Professor at Delft University of Technology
summary: I am a structural geologist with skills in outcrop analyses (fold, faults, fractures, karst), subsurface reservoirs characterisation, and geological-geomechanical modelling. My overall ambition is to contribute offering a better future for the next generations. I am developing projects focused on the prediction of geological heterogeneities in the subsurface and their simplification to improve outcrop characterisation and modelling.

[{'company': {'id': 166529, 'name': 'Technische Universiteit Delft', 'logo': 'https://media.licdn.com/dms/image/C4E0BAQFwaGpwaod9mQ/company-logo_400_400/0/1670699851986?e=1700092800&v=beta&t=772a-buTMRhp4JFw5Lp2WIlZQJ_rGzWG5O_wmvG3oQQ', 'url': 'https://www.linkedin.com/school/tudelft/', 'employees': {'start': 5001, 'end': 10000}}, 'date': {'start': {'month': 10, 'day': None, 'year': 2016}, 'end': {'month': None, 'day': None, 'year': None}}, 'profile_positions': [{'location': 'Delft, South Holland, Netherlands', 'date': {'start': {'month': 6, 'day': None, 'year': 2021}, 'end': {'month': None, 'day': None, 'year': None}}, 'company': 'Delft University of Technology', 'description': None, 'title': 'Assistant Professor at Delft University of Technology', 'employment_type': 'Full-time'}, {'location': 'Delft, Pays-Bas', 'date': {'start': {'month': 10, 'day': None, 'year': 2016}, 'end': {'month': None, 'day': None, 'year': None}}, 'company': 'Delft University of Technology', 'description': 'Characterisation, prediction and efficiency (fluid flow) evaluation of fracture networks in faulted, folded and undeformed domains (surface and subsurface)
- Structural geology: Multiscale fracture network characterisation in folded, faulted and undeformed structural settings (classical structural analysis – drone image acquisition – satellite image processing).
- Modeling: Development of a geological workflows to predict fracture geometry in outcrops and in subsurface reservoir. Evaluation of the quality of the prediction using statistics and geomechanical modelling tools. 3D models building, geometric and geo mechanical restorations, balanced cross sections.
Resulting publications: Bruna et al., 2019a,b,; Prabhakaran et al., 2019, Mittempergher et al., 2019, Lepillier et al., 2019', 'title': 'Post-Doctoral Researcher', 'employment_type': None}, {'location': 'Delft Area, Netherlands', 'date': {'start': {'month': 5, 'day': None, 'year': 2019}, 'end': {'month': 9, 'day': None, 'year': 2021}}, 'company': 'Delft University of Technology', 'description': 'Triassic tectono-sedimentary system in central Tunisia and in adjacent regions: implications for hydrocarbons
North Africa Research Group (NARG) collaboration 
The initial part of the project are centered on 
•	Multiscale structural geology study including fracture characterisation and modelling in the Southern Chotts Basin, seismic surveys, boreholes and outcrops data
•	Regional stratigraphy and sedimentology harmonization of the Triassic series in Central Tunisia
•	Petroleum system characterisation and modelling of the Southern Chotts Basin', 'title': 'Postdoctoral Researcher', 'employment_type': None}]}, {'company': {'id': 9391158, 'name': 'Mazarine Energy', 'logo': 'https://media.licdn.com/dms/image/C4D0BAQH1ZeH98oIFCA/company-logo_400_400/0/1593896739827?e=1700092800&v=beta&t=SBDXEW4AkvKC1mEA-JHcOv0dRut756B9u24_qvCx718', 'url': 'https://www.linkedin.com/company/mazarine-energy/', 'employees': {'start': 201, 'end': 500}}, 'date': {'start': {'month': 12, 'day': None, 'year': 2018}, 'end': {'month': 5, 'day': None, 'year': 2019}}, 'profile_positions': [{'location': 'The Hague Area, Netherlands', 'date': {'start': {'month': 12, 'day': None, 'year': 2018}, 'end': {'month': 5, 'day': None, 'year': 2019}}, 'company': 'Mazarine Energy', 'description': 'Structural analysis in the Southern Chotts Basin, Tunisia', 'title': 'Structural Geologist', 'employment_type': None}]}, {'company': {'id': 3485576, 'name': 'Northern Territory Government', 'logo': 'https://media.licdn.com/dms/image/C560BAQH-AN01HSh5Cg/company-logo_400_400/0/1559520919186?e=1700092800&v=beta&t=xNbeausCYKBXa1CH8j5yEQAykpF58wV5b-fKpo3IC_g', 'url': 'https://www.linkedin.com/company/ntgovernment/', 'employees': {'start': 10001, 'end': None}}, 'date': {'start': {'month': 11, 'day': None, 'year': 2013}, 'end': {'month': 8, 'day': None, 'year': 2016}}, 'profile_positions': [{'location': 'Région de Darwin, Australie', 'date': {'start': {'month': 11, 'day': None, 'year': 2013}, 'end': {'month': 8, 'day': None, 'year': 2016}}, 'company': 'Northern Territory Government', 'description': '3D modeling and structural interpretation of the greater McArthur Basin (Northern Territory, Australia): application to unconventional resources potential evaluation

3D modeling: architecture of key units providing framework for petroleum systems exploration, population of geological grids with geostatistics (facies modeling, TOC-Brittleness distributions)
Structural geology: investigation of deformation style at various scales in the studied basin from field and seismic data (balanced cross-section realization and statistic fracture and faults measurements)
Sedimentology: Fieldwork on Paleo- to Mesoproterozoic mixed clastic-carbonates systems (type section characterization, directions of sedimentary fluxes)
Cores investigation: following geochemical work on cores to select input data for 3D geomodels (petroleum industry oriented sampling and HyLogger fine characterization)
Seismic: Seismic interpretation (horizon and faults picking)', 'title': 'Project Geologist', 'employment_type': None}]}, {'company': {'id': 15250774, 'name': 'Aix-Marseille University', 'logo': 'https://media.licdn.com/dms/image/D560BAQFbo5d2-AMwqw/company-logo_400_400/0/1682325817426?e=1700092800&v=beta&t=UGXBw6gElvDTDDeAu0lc3Qg4R02bTwe_bWoAxgVEfWw', 'url': 'https://www.linkedin.com/school/aix-marseille-universite/', 'employees': {'start': 5001, 'end': 10000}}, 'date': {'start': {'month': 11, 'day': None, 'year': 2009}, 'end': {'month': 10, 'day': None, 'year': 2013}}, 'profile_positions': [{'location': 'Aix-Marseille Universite', 'date': {'start': {'month': 11, 'day': None, 'year': 2009}, 'end': {'month': 10, 'day': None, 'year': 2013}}, 'company': 'Aix-Marseille University', 'description': 'My thesis is an integrative sedimentological, structural and petrophysical characterisation of a deep aquifer nested in lower Cretaceous hemipelagic limestones (SE France). The scientific question was to understand the origins and the degree of heterogeneity to consider to best describe deep groundwater movements in such low porosity and low permeability host rocks which are analogue to unconventional reservoirs.
First, I established links between burial/uplift history and the porosity evolution of these limestones. I show that compaction of such micritic carbonated sediments is characterized by compaction bands which density depends on their initial grain content. Huge amounts of fluid can be stored in tectonically reactivated areas of the compaction bands (open stylolites) or/and in facies with preserved initial matrix porosity (turbiditic/contouritic facies) while fractures that remain located close to a few major fault zones play a relatively limited role in storage. I propose to use these simple criteria to classify a large variety of unconventional reservoirs. 
Then, I focused on permeability/storativity estimations from injection well tests and of the ways to best upscale these properties to the entire reservoir. I combined the reservoir geological model with various multivariate statistical approaches to explore the relationships between the hydraulic properties, the rocks facies, the pore types, the distance to major fault zones, the depth, etc. Final result is a method to better consider the heterogeneity at the infra-stratigraphic scale which is typical of such tight carbonate series.', 'title': 'PhD Thesis (defended 11/10/13)', 'employment_type': None}]}, {'company': {'id': 3132, 'name': 'Statoil', 'logo': 'https://media.licdn.com/dms/image/C4E0BAQH3gfja3ZZhew/company-logo_400_400/0/1519855926257?e=1700092800&v=beta&t=FizwDPEK8WHgQ9nIpAmrhKeuF_e6-kXFX6ISgB0Ay3s', 'url': 'https://www.linkedin.com/company/statoil/', 'employees': {'start': 10001, 'end': None}}, 'date': {'start': {'month': 7, 'day': None, 'year': 2009}, 'end': {'month': 9, 'day': None, 'year': 2009}}, 'profile_positions': [{'location': 'Région de Trondheim, Norvège', 'date': {'start': {'month': 7, 'day': None, 'year': 2009}, 'end': {'month': 9, 'day': None, 'year': 2009}}, 'company': 'Statoil', 'description': 'I was in charge of seismic interpretation of oil field (TUPI, Brazil). My role was to identify sedimentary geometries and structural features in a lacustrine carbonate system. I have worked essentially on Petrel software (seismic interpretation).

During this internship. My work was firstly attached to the picking of seismic horizons. Afterwards, I applied my academic and field geology knowledge to propose:
- An interpretation of identified sedimentary architectures (processes, depositional environment…)
- A classification of tectonics features and a reconstruction of the structural history of the studied area', 'title': 'Summer internship', 'employment_type': None}]}, {'company': {'id': 3132, 'name': 'Statoil', 'logo': 'https://media.licdn.com/dms/image/C4E0BAQH3gfja3ZZhew/company-logo_400_400/0/1519855926257?e=1700092800&v=beta&t=FizwDPEK8WHgQ9nIpAmrhKeuF_e6-kXFX6ISgB0Ay3s', 'url': 'https://www.linkedin.com/company/statoil/', 'employees': {'start': 10001, 'end': None}}, 'date': {'start': {'month': 6, 'day': None, 'year': 2008}, 'end': {'month': 8, 'day': None, 'year': 2008}}, 'profile_positions': [{'location': 'Région de Trondheim, Norvège', 'date': {'start': {'month': 6, 'day': None, 'year': 2008}, 'end': {'month': 8, 'day': None, 'year': 2008}}, 'company': 'Statoil', 'description': 'During my first internship in Norway (Statoil Trondheim), I was in charge of the structural analysis of Central America oil field (Gulf of Mexico). I have interpreted faults and related structures in a 3D seismic block and I have identified their relationships with hydrothermal dolomitisation processes.
In addition, in order to observe hydrothermal dolomite effects on outcrop, I participated to a geological field trip in Cantabria Mountains (Northern Spain).
This internship was my first time in Petroleum industry. I applied my structural geology knowledge to interpret seismic profiles. I have also exchanged a lot with the high level team in charge of me during my stay in Statoil (préciser qui?). I also had the opportunity to observe hydrothermal dolomitisation processes in the field. This internship was also the opportunity to work on Petrel software.', 'title': 'Summer internship', 'employment_type': None}]}, {'company': {'id': 41321662, 'name': 'GFZ-Potsdam', 'logo': 'https://media.licdn.com/dms/image/C4D0BAQG8hVXdGSmCzQ/company-logo_400_400/0/1584603380626?e=1700092800&v=beta&t=SKLby5gg_xrlgPAAFAM81uhN_8lwSQpuZKIq-9Rh7PU', 'url': 'https://www.linkedin.com/company/helmholtz-zentrum-potsdam---deutsches-geoforschungszentrum-gfz/', 'employees': {'start': 1001, 'end': 5000}}, 'date': {'start': {'month': 8, 'day': None, 'year': 2007}, 'end': {'month': 8, 'day': None, 'year': 2007}}, 'profile_positions': [{'location': 'Région de Potsdam , Allemagne + field trip in Northern Germany', 'date': {'start': {'month': 8, 'day': None, 'year': 2007}, 'end': {'month': 8, 'day': None, 'year': 2007}}, 'company': 'Helmholtz-Centre Potsdam - German Research Centre GFZ', 'description': 'I have done this summer internship (between Bachelor’s and Master’s degree) on GFZ (Potsdam) research center. I have worked on the structural geology section under the direction of J. Sippel (PhD student) and M. Scheck-Wenderoth. I was in charge to assist J. Sippel on field tectonic measurements and a sedimentological characterisation of numerous quarries in the NE German basin.  
During this internship, I applied structural geology skills that I have learned at the university. I have also helped J. Sippel for sedimentary concepts characterization on her PhD work.', 'title': 'Summer student', 'employment_type': None}]}, {'company': {'id': None, 'name': 'Rock Magnetic Analyses', 'logo': None, 'url': None, 'employees': {'start': None, 'end': None}}, 'date': {'start': {'month': 5, 'day': None, 'year': 2007}, 'end': {'month': 5, 'day': None, 'year': 2007}}, 'profile_positions': [{'location': 'Région de Marseille, France', 'date': {'start': {'month': 5, 'day': None, 'year': 2007}, 'end': {'month': 5, 'day': None, 'year': 2007}}, 'company': 'Rock Magnetic Analyses', 'description': 'During My bachelor’s degree, I have studied the Malampaya oil field carbonate cuttings and I have measured magnetic susceptibility on a series of 65 samples. I have compared obtained values to gamma ray and to δ13C signals. This study allowed me to propose magnetic susceptibility as a potential new petrophysical tool to identify remarkable surfaces and thus to characterize the carbonate platform architecture.
During this internship I have discovered the academic research topic. I have been trained to the magnetic susceptibility and to diagraphic tools (gamma ray, sonic, neutron…) used to characterize oil field. I have also been formed to statistics and to the use of software (grapher, tanagra, illustrator)', 'title': 'Scholar internship', 'employment_type': None}]}]
